sourceText: Millions of people have the same fears as us. Find someone who you can talk to about how you are feeling.
text: Millions of people have the same fears as us. Find someone who you can talk to about how you are feeling.

sourceText: Listen to them. Avoid social media that makes you feel panicked.
text: Listen to them. Avoid social media that makes you feel panicked.

sourceText: You are not alone.
text: You are not alone.

sourceText: Take a break.
text: Take a break.

sourceText: Listen to your kids.
text: Listen to your kids.

sourceText: Take a Pause.
text: Take a Pause.

sourceText: 1-minute relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried.
text: 1-minute relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried.

sourceText: Step 1: Set up
text: Step 1: Set up

sourceText: •	Find a comfortable sitting position, your feet flat on the floor, your hands resting in your lap.
text: •	Find a comfortable sitting position, your feet flat on the floor, your hands resting in your lap.

sourceText: • 	Close your eyes if you feel comfortable.
text: • 	Close your eyes if you feel comfortable.

sourceText: Step 2: Think, feel, body
text: Step 2: Think, feel, body

sourceText: • 	Ask yourself, “What am I thinking now?”
text: • 	Ask yourself, “What am I thinking now?”

sourceText: • 	Notice your thoughts. Notice if they are negative or positive.
text: • 	Notice your thoughts. Notice if they are negative or positive.

sourceText: • 	Notice how you feel emotionally. Notice if your feelings are happy or not.
text: • 	Notice how you feel emotionally. Notice if your feelings are happy or not.

sourceText: • 	Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.
text: • 	Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.

sourceText: Step 3: Focus on your breath
text: Step 3: Focus on your breath

sourceText: • 	Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.
text: • 	Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.

sourceText: • 	You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath.
text: • 	You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath.

sourceText: • 	You may want to say to yourself “It’s okay.Whatever it is, I am okay.”
text: • 	You may want to say to yourself “It’s okay.Whatever it is, I am okay.”

sourceText: • 	Then just listen to your breath for a while.
text: • 	Then just listen to your breath for a while.

sourceText: Step 4: Coming back
text: Step 4: Coming back

sourceText: • 	Notice how your whole body feels.
text: • 	Notice how your whole body feels.

sourceText: • 	Listen to the sounds in the room.
text: • 	Listen to the sounds in the room.

sourceText: Step 5: Reflecting
text: Step 5: Reflecting

sourceText: • 	Think “do I feel different at all?”.
text: • 	Think “do I feel different at all?”.

sourceText: • 	When you are ready, open your eyes.
text: • 	When you are ready, open your eyes.

sourceText: Be open and listen to your children. Your children will look to you for support and reassurance.
text: Be open and listen to your children. Your children will look to you for support and reassurance.

sourceText: Listen to your children when they share how they are feeling.
text: Listen to your children when they share how they are feeling.

sourceText: Accept how they feel and give them  comfort.
text: Accept how they feel and give them  comfort.

sourceText: Taking a Pause can also be helpful when you find your child is irritating you or has done something wrong. It gives you a chance to be calmer.
text: Taking a Pause can also be helpful when you find your child is irritating you or has done something wrong. It gives you a chance to be calmer.

sourceText: Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the feeling of the floor beneath can make a difference.
text: Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the feeling of the floor beneath can make a difference.

sourceText: You can also Take a Pause with your children!
text: You can also Take a Pause with your children!

sourceText: Keep Calm and Manage Stress
text: Keep Calm and Manage Stress

text: Covid-19 Parenting

sourceText: This is a stressful time. Take care of yourself, so you can support your children.
text: This is a stressful time. Take care of yourself, so you can support your children.

sourceText: We all need a break sometimes. When your children are asleep, do something fun or relaxing for yourself.
text: We all need a break sometimes. When your children are asleep, do something fun or relaxing for yourself.

sourceText: Make a list of healthy activities that YOU like to do. You deserve it!
text: Make a list of healthy activities that YOU like to do. You deserve it!
